commit_message:
Add a WBE worker finder base class and use it

To allow for future implementations (using tooz or other)
have the current worker finder derive from a base class that
provides functionality that should be common to all worker
finders.

Part of blueprint wbe-worker-info

Change-Id: Ie5e8b7571a2759a230ed247c10b276aadc737572

commit_message:
Set locale before check dnsmasq version

In some locale settings, cmd "dnsmasq --version" returns unexpected
result even when dnsmasq is the right version.

This fix sets env variable as "LC_ALL=C" to make sure dnsmasq version
check returns correct result.

Change-Id: I3d1c7793632f2c62e7b54e250e052de15f978e59
Closes-Bug:1412738

commit_message:
Drop deprecated namespace for oslo.rootwrap

The oslo team is recommending everyone to switch to the
non-namespaced versions of libraries.[1]
oslo.rootwrap suggests use oslo_rootwrap.cmd:main.[2]

[1]https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/drop-namespace-packages
[2]https://github.com/openstack/oslo.rootwrap#using

Change-Id: Ifa37c01b95c65bc3b4966283ff289dd724a7f8cd

commit_message:
Hardening unittest, make resilient to address assignment order

Changed functions in test_db_plugin.py and test_n1kv_plugin.py
to replace assertEqual with assertIn

Closes-Bug: #1416135

Allow add l3 agent to Ha router

If a Ha router has l3 agents less than 'max_l3_agents_per_router',
it should allow add l3 agent to this Ha router.

Closes-Bug: #1416326

subject: autohelp: don't specify encoding in the base xml
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 6772, 'name': 'Stephen Gordon', 'email': 'sgordon@redhat.com', 'username': 'sgordon'}, {'_account_id': 9562, 'name': 'Ildiko Vancsa', 'email': 'ildiko.vancsa@gmail.com', 'username': 'ildikov'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-31 11:28:44.000000000', 'files': ['autogenerate_config_docs/autohelp.py', 'autogenerate_config_docs/extract_swift_flags.py'], 'message': "autohelp: don't specify encoding in the base xml

Specifying the encoding and working with unicode strings in not
supported in lxml. The BASE_XML string is only used to init the XML tree
and does not need a specific encoding. The utf-8 encoding is explicitely
added when the final XML is written to file.

Change-Id: I74e0a316cf718ad9768a690f8ccc4a1cc9a9fc7e
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
autohelp: don't specify encoding in the base xml

Specifying the encoding and working with unicode strings in not
supported in lxml. The BASE_XML string is only used to init the XML tree
and does not need a specific encoding. The utf-8 encoding is explicitely
added when the final XML is written to file.

Change-Id: I74e0a316cf718ad9768a690f8ccc4a1cc9a9fc7e

commit_message:
Remove workaround for Nova VM boot bug

Boot of VM with provided Neutron port id works again after merge of following:
I01b561ac8b9b29cc4721d88567678a42a4fd1f6b
that is revert for
d8cafb9a6efb95b78609aca8fcb3532c33a1788f

So, we do not need workaround anymore and can test Manila against latest Nova.

Change-Id: I3d1c06e14380efaaad0fe0b06d9d4435ebb1a863

Use the "iterate timeout" idiom from nodepool

When waiting for something to happen inside of a timeout loop,
use a generator to simplify and standardize the pattern.

commit_message:
Remove startswith for share_proto check

We have explicit definition for supported share protocols.
Using "startswith" to search for substring is not a right way.

Change-Id: I8f482aea74249efca3bd490d971cf3e944919bb8

Instead of skipping only lines starting with a '#' (comments), also skip

commit_message:
labs: abort on config/scripts.* syntax errors

Instead of skipping only lines starting with a '#' (comments), also skip
empty lines. For all other lines that are not commands, abort with a
syntax error.

Change-Id: I5e326f2eb27e4aa72ff75a211e36bc3b3a78126f

commit_message:
labs: rename config/scripts.<distro>

Rename config/scripts.<distro> files to config/scripts.<distro>_base,
making it clear that these distro-specific scripts lists are only
used for the base disk.

Punctuation and Copyright changes.

Very minor changes related to punctuation and removal of an
incorrect copyright.

copyright, through change-id
Ie4b4785b7c93246147c8d9e6a172621f454301ae. Removing it..

commit_message:
Configure glance notification driver

Glance does not use the message queue without the optional Telemetry
service.  Set default glance notification_driver values to noop.  This
prevents creation of a queue with no consumer and eliminates issues with
the additional configuration necessary for notifications.  The Telemetry
chapter reconfigures glance to properly use notifications.

Change-Id: If4e3d7cbfb18b7a9f8ae4c1d7309664b30a03a73
Closes-bug: 1404956
backport: juno

commit_message:
Move ha router functionality from the agent to ha_router

This was pretty much a mechanical change.  Most of the methods passed
in ri as the first argument and so changing the way they're called was
a simple matter of replacing self with ri.  In the methods themselves,
I first made sure that self was not referenced for anything that
wasn't available in the router context and then replaced ri with self.

Change-Id: I2f9e23543a10da256d33c4c32a50aa2b8c93989d
Partially-Implements: bp/restructure-l3-agent

Fix broken network topology css

Fixes toggle button, puts icon and changes bgcolor.
Changes the position of "Add interface" button in balloon.
Remove networktopology css from horizon.scss

Co-Authored-By: Lin Hua Cheng <os.lcheng@gmail.com>

commit_message:
labs: Make snapshot names unique

A unique name (across node VMs) for each snapshot will make it easier
for test scripts to restore partially built clusters. The names can
always be changed/improved later, what matter to the scripts is only
that they be unique.

Change-Id: I8d698d0ccca754de2220b563583e3853612d74b7

commit_message:
403 page displays trans template tag

trans template tag is not evaluated because it is on multiple lines. 
This fixes the issue.

Change-Id: Ifd820fd1b15de5c07caf69d0b1382f49630cccc7
Closes-Bug: #1416248

commit_message:
Implement 'InstanceId' for autoscaling group

Implement 'InstanceId' for AWS::AutoScaling::AutoScalingGroup
resource to be compatible with AWSCloudFormation.

Implements: blueprint implement-instanceid-for-autoscalinggroup
Change-Id: I939798202d27c3a16a502a148efe37e44077bda8

commit_message:
Clean-up deleted/refactored puppet module repo not

Project-config was prepared for the puppet module split by pre-merging
numerous changes: I311af3f7eb724115ba6a2496d0aea4910a98f632

Now that the work is complete, there are some that were not split
but rather deleted and/or refactored.

Clean these up now, as planned.

Spec: http://specs.openstack.org/openstack-infra/infra-specs/specs/puppet-modules.html

Change-Id: Ic461b639e2450cc325fb82565a88c9cc65962491

commit_message:
Move missing periodic qa jobs to tempest experimental

This commit adds the 2 jobs periodic tempest jobs missing from the
experimental list to the list. We want to be able to trigger the
jobs run periodically on commits to verify functionality manually
on certain commits.

Change-Id: I58391c662d840707abecf25b1998245cad12d486

commit_message:
Stop getting console.txt for swift logs

We are successfully downloading the console.html log and reuploading it
to swift now. Stop downloading the console.txt file which does not
include any timestamps and is not uploaded.

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-29 04:46:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'No longer pass user to init-keystone

Now that we no longer perform PKI setup using init-keystone, we no
longer need to pass the now-optional user argument to init-keystone.

Change-Id: I5f5a3d948b244e940059549d2033d330d6ae230f
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-01-30 04:40:12.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/devtest_seed.sh', 'scripts/devtest_undercloud.sh', 'scripts/devtest_overcloud.sh'], 'message': 'No longer pass user to init-keystone

From os-cloud-config 0.2.1, the user argument is no longer required
for init-keystone if PKI setup is not performed, so drop it from
our calls.

Change-Id: I5f5a3d948b244e940059549d2033d330d6ae230f
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
No longer pass user to init-keystone

From os-cloud-config 0.2.1, the user argument is no longer required
for init-keystone if PKI setup is not performed, so drop it from
our calls.

Change-Id: I5f5a3d948b244e940059549d2033d330d6ae230f

commit_message:
added flavor id in instance detail page

in instance table, we can filter out the
instances by using the flavor id.

but there is no way to get the flavor id
in horizon for non admin users.

so adding the flavor id in instance detail
and popover flavor detail table.

Change-Id: I4995d9181a47bb7e15ce8b2c7b4252e389d91c71
Closes-Bug: #1415825

commit_message:
Enables the editing of Allocation pools in edit subnet

This patch enables the editing of the allocation pools in the edit
subnet form. It removes the allocation pools hidden field because it
is defined in the base class. So this make allocation pools field
visible in the edit form with pre-populated values.

Change-Id: I8d0c35f0694cc5a651747209bee6d38c1d9e26a9
Closes-bug: #1410173

commit_message:
Add and use a nicer kombu message formatter

Since the kombu message object that is recieved has
no useful __str__ or __repr__ and on reception and processing
we should the message (and the delivery tag) it is nice to have
a more useful formatting of that message for debugging and
such (where more detail about the messages are quite useful
to see).

Change-Id: I6730b10122a5de1a0a074525931f312fbd97b8c0

commit_message:
Fix neutron-fwaas unit test failures due to multiple issues

neutron-fwaas unit tests are failing due the following issues:

[1] init parameters of router_info.RouterInfo.
[2] 'register_process_monitor_opts' in varmour router and fwaas UT.

This patch fixes those issues.

Closes-Bug: #1416522

Change-Id: I70a4b47777ea41a8070253cf17e667cb9fec0dea

commit_message:
Create LOGDIR if it doesn't exist

Create LOGDIR when LOGFILE is not set.  This fix is rather blunt
as logging setup will be further tweaked as
https://github.com/openstack/qa-specs/blob/master/specs/devstack/devstack-logging-and-service-names.rst
progresses.

Change-Id: I4a574f295eb6d55c7196ec563bd356d6c0bc8833

subject: Revert "Exit after printing error about RPC config"
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 970, 'name': 'Dean Troyer', 'email': 'dtroyer@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtroyer'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 4146, 'name': 'Clark Boylan', 'email': 'cboylan@sapwetik.org', 'username': 'cboylan'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-29 17:26:25.000000000', 'files': ['lib/rpc_backend'], 'message': 'Revert "Exit after printing error about RPC config"

This reverts commit c1dbf10562796c7006fd0a66c6cb39a1b990c8c1.

Reverting because it is valid to run devstack without enabling an rpc
backend. For example when you run devstack on a multinode deployment
compute hosts probably shouldn't run rabbit and instead will just talk
to the rabbit server set up on the controller node. As a result we
should not die when no rpc backends are set.

Change-Id: If9a31e031552f4161d42094fa960221b4d9e893c
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Revert "Exit after printing error about RPC config"

This reverts commit c1dbf10562796c7006fd0a66c6cb39a1b990c8c1.

Reverting because it is valid to run devstack without enabling an rpc
backend. For example when you run devstack on a multinode deployment
compute hosts probably shouldn't run rabbit and instead will just talk
to the rabbit server set up on the controller node. As a result we
should not die when no rpc backends are set.

Change-Id: If9a31e031552f4161d42094fa960221b4d9e893c

[{'created': '2015-01-31 00:10:37.000000000', 'files': ['USECASES.md', 'spec/system/ceph_usecases_spec.rb'], 'message': 'fix usecases CI tests by limiting journal size to 100M

The CI VMs have only 10G of disk space on the root disk available.
When creating an OSD backed by a folder on the root file system this
leads to out of space errors during the test runs.

Change-Id: I0637781b362fbfcca0180fb7506acf7059a75f79
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
fix usecases CI tests by limiting journal size to 100M

The CI VMs have only 10G of disk space on the root disk available.
When creating an OSD backed by a folder on the root file system this
leads to out of space errors during the test runs.

Change-Id: I0637781b362fbfcca0180fb7506acf7059a75f79

commit_message:
libvirt: always pass image meta when getting disk info from bdm

The blockinfo.get_info_from_bdm method is changed to make the
image_meta parameter compulsory and the callers/tests updated
to ensure they always passes it

Related-bug: #1404196
Change-Id: Ibf267e8a689897861582866ca9266cc25475ad89

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-29 11:52:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Apply v2.1 API to href of version API

Now Nova contains v2 and v2.1 APIs, but version API returns the same
href between v2 and v2.1 like:
  {"href": "http://192.168.11.62:8774/v2/", "rel": "self"}
in a response.
This patch fixes the problem for returning a right href.

Change-Id: Ie3ac1223a9c88a33bcc037c7a50ac308bcebea2d
Closes-Bug: #1373741
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-01-29 12:08:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Apply v2.1 API to href of version API

Now Nova contains v2 and v2.1 APIs, but version API returns the same
href between v2 and v2.1 like:
  {"href": "http://192.168.11.62:8774/v2/", "rel": "self"}
in a response.
In addition, current generate_href() handles v3 API case also. However
v3 API has disappeared, so the code is meaningless now.
This patch fixes the problem for returning a right href.

Change-Id: Ie3ac1223a9c88a33bcc037c7a50ac308bcebea2d
Closes-Bug: #1373741
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-01-29 12:13:51.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/api_samples/versions-get-resp.json.tpl', 'doc/api_samples/versions-get-resp.json', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/views/versions.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_versions.py'], 'message': 'Apply v2.1 API to href of version API

Now Nova contains v2 and v2.1 APIs, but version API returns the same
href between v2 and v2.1 like:
  {"href": "http://192.168.11.62:8774/v2/", "rel": "self"}
in a response.
In addition, current generate_href() handles v3 API case also. However
v3 API has disappeared, so the code is meaningless now.
This patch fixes the problem for returning a right href.

commit_message:
Apply v2.1 API to href of version API

Now Nova contains v2 and v2.1 APIs, but version API returns the same
href between v2 and v2.1 like:
  {"href": "http://192.168.11.62:8774/v2/", "rel": "self"}
in a response.
In addition, current generate_href() handles v3 API case also. However
v3 API has disappeared, so the code is meaningless now.
This patch fixes the problem for returning a right href.

Change-Id: Ie3ac1223a9c88a33bcc037c7a50ac308bcebea2d
Closes-Bug: #1373741

commit_message:
Fix create server request in test_network_v6

As Nova V2.1 is much strict about API inputs, Security group name
only is accepted on create server request as a security group
parameter.

test_network_v6 passes complete security group (name, id, rules etc)
in create server request and fails for Nova V2.1.

Closes-Bug: #1414967

Change-Id: I45adde0c7c4134ea087427f23f2e45d7ec9c88e7

commit_message:
Handle ironic_client non-existent case

When call os-baremetal-nodes API at the environment
in which ironic is not enable, internal error occurs
because ironicclient module doesn't exist.
This patch set fixes this bug by raising HTTPNotImplemented in such a case.

Change-Id: I64cf5a2b38b729dbdeb68887f0ddf0866e9679a0
Closes-Bug: #1414522

commit_message:
Drop nova-manage CLI tests

nova manage tests really don't belong in tempest, and the risk of having
no test coverage for these until nova has its own coverage via
functional testing is minimal.

Change-Id: I2a4da6a0d858f89fd0c91aac6e94075bc21e19be

commit_message:
Use a workarounds option to disable rootwrap

Create a workarounds option to disable rootwrap to work around
recent setuptools changes that impacted PBRs ability to make
rootwrap performance not terrible.

DocImpact
Related-Bug: #1415106

Change-Id: Iad1e57b18e490a10b1638f00f21e05e7e2a68b22

commit_message:
Update TOSCA version

TOSCA version naming has been changed and per the latest specs the correct
current version is tosca_simple_yaml_1_0_0.

Change-Id: I8a7ddf70f6e74fac1134a0674e44c498f661d51e
Closes-Bug: #1339154

commit_message:
Add requirements.txt file for OpenDaylight Mech Driver

Move the driver into its own module, but make the change
backward compatible so that we don't break the ODL driver
counterpart (which will use the new module when [1] merges).

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/151707/

Related-Bug: #1409149
Partial-Implements: bp/core-vendor-decomposition

commit_message:
Remove duplicate logging of attribute validation errors

Removed logging at top level function _validate_dict() and
added logging at the lower level functions wherever necessary.

Change-Id: I09ec62ef5998aea5735ff641166cbc5b469775e9
Closes-bug: #1397310

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-16 21:53:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Runtime Metadata Definitions

This will provide a base library of metadata definitions for various
common software runtimes that may exist on
particular image (or volume or instance). These metadata definitions will
make it easier for end users and admins to easily describe the software and
its properties. This information will enable an improved and faster user
experience for applying software metadata, searching based on software
metadata, and viewing the software information about an image.

Various improvements in horizon are underway to take advantage of this
metadata. For example, a user launching an instance will be able to expand
the image row to see addition information about the image.  This will include
providing the metadata definition for properties on the image.  This same
information will also be visible from the image and instance details page.

The following screenshot mockup provides an example from the instance details:
https://wiki.openstack.org/w/images/3/37/Instance-details-mock-january-2015.png

Change-Id: I0ee3e6a3b9d26c231bf0c823e0198f1c5f4cc963

commit_message:
Runtime Metadata Definitions

The will provide a base library of metadata definitions for
various common software products, components, and libraries that
may exist on particular image (or volume or instance). These
metadata definitions will make it easier for end users and
admins to easily describe the software and its properties.
This information will enable an improved and faster user
experience for applying software metadata, searching based
on software metadata, and viewing the software information
about an image.

Various improvements in horizon are underway to take
advantage of this metadata. For example, a user launching
an instance will be able to expand the image row to see
additional information about the image.  This will include
providing the metadata definition for properties on the image.
This same information will also be visible from the image and
instance details page.

Change-Id: I0ee3e6a3b9d26c231bf0c823e0198f1c5f4cc963
Implements: blueprint software-metadefs

commit_message:
Transform sample_cnt type to int

Duration is seconds from current time, and sample_cnt on
the basis of duration. So sample_cnt always not a int, but
we need sample_cnt as a int type.

Closes-Bug:#1330330

Change-Id: I89e1768523384e24c3a0b8b76f4fa04a123248f9

commit_message:
Create a 'workarounds' config group.

This group is for very specific reasons.

If you're:
- Working around an issue in a system tool (e.g. libvirt or qemu) where the fix
  is in flight/discussed in that community.
- The tool can be/is fixed in some distributions and rather than patch the code
  those distributions can trivially set a config option to get the "correct"
  behavior.
This is a good place for your workaround.

Change-Id: I035960dd9c6eec5a6b5e83fa3a4841dc9f7d20fa

commit_message:
Initial directory changes and files for python-babricanclient functional tests

The utils file was copied from the barbican api functional tests repo.
No changes were made to the utils file.
The base.py file contains the oslo testcase setup.
Also added functional_tests conf file for identity and barbican information.

commit_message:
don't use exec cat when we can use read

Some very old code in linux_net was using a subprocess call to cat
instead of a file read, largely from copy and pasting. It caused some
extra process calls that are not needed.

Convert to a function which uses normal python open / read call.

Change-Id: I08010cdfa8e7d5f7c7aeb8d3a5b47079022e676b

commit_message:
don't assert_called_once_with with a real time

This test failed in the gate because there was a 10ms delay between
the time allocation and the assert_called_once_with (so the time
parameter did not match). Instead use mock.ANY for the time field, the
payload is not important.

Change-Id: Ibf7041280c7c6cc50334bc6b8489c4c1c38ecb24

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary checks from migration commands

When doing the alembic setup to enable the usage of the commands API,
there were some unnecessary checks in each command to verify that the
alembic configuration isn't a falsey value. Although, there is no
scenario where this could happen, since proper exceptions are thrown.
So this fixes that.

Change-Id: Ibc1b2ebefd13d7569e1ff69de873cfc557804a76

[{'created': '2015-01-28 12:54:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Network: corrext VMware DVS port group name

Commit 709127cabed602d6868dedf0bef7ca9547a86e06 added support
for DVS network backends. The original design included the
name of the network in the port group. The name was excluded to to
VC limitations (maximum of 80 characters for a port group name).
This prevents instances from being booted as there is no match
for the port group.

The fix enasures that we only use the Neutron network UUID.

commit_message:
Network: correct VMware DVS port group name lookup

Commit 709127cabed602d6868dedf0bef7ca9547a86e06 added support
for DVS network backends. The original design included the
name of the network in the port group. The name was excluded due
to VC limitations (maximum of 80 characters for a port group name).
This prevents instances from being booted as there is no match
for the port group.

The fix ensures that we only use the Neutron network UUID.

Change-Id: I7e3223f88c4f477116ac493eb45466ea1c0a29a9
Closes-bug: #1415461

commit_message:
Add 'history' option to the migration script

This is an initial implementation of a 'history' option, which enables
you to see the available migration scripts and their appropriate
hashes. This is helpful when debugging migration errors, as it allows
you to easily get information about the scripts without having to see
the files (when using the verbose option).

commit_message:
Switch Python's json to the OpenStack's json wrapper

In a couple of parts of the code, the json library is imported
explicitly. The openstack.common.jsonutils module aims for
compatibility, so I switched the direct import to that one.

Change-Id: I9121255da35a15bce55e9993dfc08ab465e713a4

commit_message:
Updates to LBaaSV2 extension

These updates improve and simplify the user experience of
the neutron lbaas v2 API.  This is needed to merge changes
into the neutron-lbaas repository since it requires the
extension in some imports as well as the API it exposes.

Added the statuses action off of the load balancer resource.
This will be used to retrieve the status tree of a load
balancer and its children.

Removed status attribute from being shown on entities.

Change-Id: I8fc33922d662d6547a57e13c8b5f31fbb6154ae0
Partially-implements: blueprint lbaas-api-and-objmodel-improvement

I renamed the fields deletion related fields that would potentially
get outputted when doing a "to_dict_fields" operation on any model
that inherits from the base model. Now, we do not display deleted
entities through the API. But at some point we could be using this for

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Renamed outputted keys from base model

I renamed the fields deletion related fields that would potentially
get outputted when doing a "to_dict_fields" operation on any model
that inherits from the base model. Now, we do not display deleted
entities through the API. But at some point we could be using this for
auditing. So this change was done to promote consistency.

Change-Id: Ieb90005a1cb1b75bb6182366d774b219564b073f

[{'created': '2015-01-20 23:49:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Thining Arista ML2 driver from neutron tree

Moving all the back-end drivers for the Arista
ML2 driver. The DB Models and Config part is
left in the tree. Rest all is moving to
networking-arista project.

At present this is a WIP (as all tests are

commit_message:
Thining Arista ML2 driver from neutron tree

Moving all the back-end drivers for the Arista
ML2 driver. The DB Models and Config is
left in the tree. Rest all is moving to
networking-arista project.

Reorganize the code to ensure a smoother transition
to a decomposed Arista ML2 driver.

The code is being moved in [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/148682/

Partial-bug: 1412577
Related-blueprint: core-vendor-decomposition

Change-Id: Ibbd82d7a18fdb8d6b8d4bfa7bcafe8a2d91a20e1
Co-Authored-By: Armando Migliaccio <armamig@gmail.com>

This adds flavor, old_flavor, and new_flavor fields to the Instance object.
Right now, these basically proxy through to system_metadata, which will
provide us a mechanism to get things off of the legacy mechanisms and then
convert the storage underneath.

Related to blueprint flavor-from-sysmeta-to-blob

', 'number': 7}, {'created': '2014-11-25 17:24:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add flavor fields to Instance object

This adds flavor, old_flavor, and new_flavor fields to the Instance object.
Flavor information is persisted in blob format in instance_extra.flavor.

Compatibility with flavors stored in system_metadata will be maintained
for fetches. The information will be stored in extra.flavor on save. Because
we didn't store (all of) flavor extra_specs in system_metadata, a fetch of
the original flavor is required to merge the rest of extra_specs in before
we do the save. This will cause an additional lookup at load time.

Instances backported to versions before this change was introduced will
have system_metadata reconstructed/augmented with the flavor information
so that older nodes will be happy.

Related to blueprint flavor-from-sysmeta-to-blob

Change-Id: I4dff5267902362057cc5ee18357539b7192782cb

", 'number': 15}, {'created': '2014-12-02 19:03:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add flavor fields to Instance object

This adds flavor, old_flavor, and new_flavor fields to the Instance object.
Flavor information is persisted in blob format in instance_extra.flavor.

Compatibility with flavors stored in system_metadata will be maintained
for fetches. The information will be stored in extra.flavor on save. Because
we didn't store (all of) flavor extra_specs in system_metadata, a fetch of
the original flavor is required to merge the rest of extra_specs in before
we do the save. This will cause an additional lookup at load time.

Instances backported to versions before this change was introduced will
have system_metadata reconstructed/augmented with the flavor information
so that older nodes will be happy.

Related to blueprint flavor-from-sysmeta-to-blob

Change-Id: I4dff5267902362057cc5ee18357539b7192782cb

commit_message:
Add flavor fields to Instance object

This adds flavor, old_flavor, and new_flavor fields to the Instance object.
Flavor information is persisted in blob format in instance_extra.flavor.

Compatibility with flavors stored in system_metadata will be maintained
for fetches. The information will be stored in extra.flavor on save. Because
we didn't store (all of) flavor extra_specs in system_metadata, a fetch of
the original flavor is required to merge the rest of extra_specs in before
we do the save. This will cause an additional lookup at load time.

Instances backported to versions before this change was introduced will
have system_metadata reconstructed/augmented with the flavor information
so that older nodes will be happy.

Related to blueprint flavor-from-sysmeta-to-blob

Change-Id: I4dff5267902362057cc5ee18357539b7192782cb

commit_message:
libvirt: Use XPath instead of loop in _get_disk_xml

etree supports XPath to find specific node, so we don't need
find the node with comparing its tag and attribute. This commit
uses Xpath in method _get_disk_xml and adds unit test for it.

Partial-Bug: #1407915
Change-Id: I281ac663d492bb041d7f668894706bba9e111725

commit_message:
Remove copy-pasted code for fake-share

There are amounts of copy-pasted code for fake separated
in different files, they should be put in one place.

This patch moves the following into module fake_share:
    * fake_share
    * fake_snapshot
    * fake_access

Partial-Bug: #1416285

Change-Id: I78e7fc56c80ee19a8c01c5f37b428f019aa47e58

commit_message:
Revert "Adds keypair type database migration"

This reverts commit b4d57ab65836460d0d9cb8889ec2e6c3986c0a9b.

The migration uses a String (VARCHAR) type when the model uses Enum,
which is the intended type.

Unfortunately, doing a migration from VARCHAR to Enum on PostgreSQL is
a lot of work.

Due to policy around never removing a migration, we replace it with a noop
migration instead. For the deployers who might have created this column,
we need to remember to delete this column if it exists later.

UpgradeImpact: if you have deployed migration 272 before this revert and
run hyper-v, you need to come talk to us.

Co-authored-by: Michael Still <mikal@stillhq.com>

Change-Id: I506dd1c8d0f0a877fdfc1a4ed11a8830d9600b98

commit_message:
Raise NotFound if attach interface with invalid net id or port id

When posting an 'attach interface' request to Nova with an invalid
network id or port id, Nova returns HTTP 500 which indicates the
attach operation fails. In fact, Nova get an empty network list or
PortNotFound exception from Neutron due to incorrect input. Nova
should address the error and raise NotFound in order to inform the
user to correct the request.

Change-Id: I3c5e07d5d6920a750d25398da8388a39b76a2944
Closes-Bug: 1370359
Closes-Bug: 1382343

commit_message:
Add limit stanzas for mongos

- file size
- cpu time
- open files
- virtual memory size
- processes/threads

http://docs.mongodb.org/manual/reference/ulimit/#recommended-ulimit-settings

Change-Id: I25b7c82e1ded4b9d19652b99aa18ef7e3a27ea81
Closes-Bug: #1387353

commit_message:
Specify keystone SQL revocation driver

The default keystone configuration file included with most distributions
uses the deprecated 'keystone.contrib.revoke.backends.kvs' revocation
backend driver.  Use the keystone.contrib.revoke.backends.sql driver
instead.

Change-Id: I2c125fbd62346063f6cf2dd8ed71fcc85095f402
backport: juno
Closes-Bug: 1404969

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-12-17 18:43:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Support for ext4 as default filesystem for ephemeral disks

The ext3 filesystem does orders of magnitude more I/O than ext4 in
mkfs - a brief benchmark showed 14m to make a 1TB ext3 filesystem
vs 7 seconds to make a 1TB ext4 filesystem, with the ext3 filesystem
doing upwards of 6GB I/O.

Since ext4 has been a default in all major Linux distributions for
a long time now - RHEL5 has it as default, for instance - there is
no reason to default to ext3: users that need ext3 can configure
that themselves.

Note that there is still support for ext3 as the default if some
deployers do choose to keep that as the default, by using either
virt_mkfs or default_ephemeral_format configuration option. We
are just trying to move the default for everyone who is starting
fresh.

Originally logged by lifeless as I833356af81df743a63d4442d389be82bc25f3914,
reverted in I8de225729bbc77b263fcac2fa72b0e9cc6c1b2bf by phil and re-proposed
by swapnil in Ibe9e9ba4265125c5bd933cde1a93cca02511bb46

DocImpact

Closes-Bug: #1266262
Change-Id: I92cb51c6118e48fd66ada0e2fee624597c4ad8f0

commit_message:
Support for ext4 as default filesystem for ephemeral disks

The ext3 filesystem does orders of magnitude more I/O than ext4 in
mkfs - a brief benchmark showed 14m to make a 1TB ext3 filesystem
vs 7 seconds to make a 1TB ext4 filesystem, with the ext3 filesystem
doing upwards of 6GB I/O.

Since ext4 has been a default in all major Linux distributions for
a long time now - RHEL5 has it as default, for instance - there is
no reason to default to ext3: users that need ext3 can configure
that themselves. So the default now is ext4 for all linux with
this commit. Also note that for non-linux and non-windows
the default used to be ext3, now it is vfat.

Note that there is still support for ext3 as the default if some
deployers do choose to keep that as the default, by using either
virt_mkfs or default_ephemeral_format configuration option. We
are just trying to move the default for everyone who is starting
fresh.

Originally logged by lifeless as I833356af81df743a63d4442d389be82bc25f3914,
reverted in I8de225729bbc77b263fcac2fa72b0e9cc6c1b2bf by phil and re-proposed
by swapnil in Ibe9e9ba4265125c5bd933cde1a93cca02511bb46

DocImpact

Closes-Bug: #1266262
Change-Id: I92cb51c6118e48fd66ada0e2fee624597c4ad8f0

commit_message:
Init default lvm volume group only if required

A recent patch [1] added support for lvm ephemeral storage for nova,
but at the cost of initializing a default lvm volume group even if it
was not required.  This change ensures that init of the default volume
group is only performed when nova and/or cinder are configured to use
lvm.

1: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/132333

Change-Id: I7634ca0ed0ffe1b13464e4d66744918f85149f2e
Closes-Bug: #1414820

[{'created': '2014-12-17 05:04:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Change default value of multi_instance_display_name_template

As per bug 1238910, instance names longer then 63 characters get
truncated when turned into hostnames. Previously
multi_instance_display_name_template defaulted to appending a entire 37
character uuid to each instance name, leaving only 26 characters left
before the hostname gets truncated.

Instead of using over half the possible hostname with a UUID, default to

commit_message:
Change default value of multi_instance_display_name_template

As per bug 1238910, instance names longer then 63 characters get
truncated when turned into hostnames. Previously
multi_instance_display_name_template defaulted to appending a entire 37
character uuid to each instance name, leaving only 26 characters left
before the hostname gets truncated.

Instead of using over half the possible hostname with a UUID, default to
just appending the count.

Add unit test to test default multi_instance_display_name_template
value.

DocImpact
UpgradeImpact

Change-Id: I111ceae5df56a9b3050e4a7c97a0320fb3c0ff23
Closes-Bug: 1403312

The Cinder LVMISCSIDriver is now deprecated. As a result, default
settings in devstack are giving warnings in the Cinder volume serivce.
The LVMVolumeDriver now handles all cases, by looking at the
iscsi_helper. This will use that driver instead, which will stop the
deprecation warnings.

commit_message:
Use LVMVolumeDriver instead of LVMISCSIDriver

The Cinder LVMISCSIDriver is now deprecated. As a result, default
settings in devstack are giving warnings in the Cinder volume serivce.
The LVMVolumeDriver now handles all cases, by looking at the
iscsi_helper. This will use that driver instead, which will stop the
deprecation warnings.

Closes-bug: #1413761
Change-Id: Ifbb9ce45694095ff9e30f3ca4c3859a07de8df73

commit_message:
Add support of arg "access_level" to allow_access operation

Add new option 'access_level' to manilaclient's access-allow function.
Manila API of share access should allow user to choose one of the following
access modes: 'ro' and 'rw'.

Add new field 'access_level' to result of 'access-list' function.

Fix unit tests and add new ones.

Implements bp level-of-access-for-shares

Change-Id: I96bf7a1b8a8fe9013d0c8b6e63d312a2134bd3e0

commit_message:
remove duplicate matching id check when updating user

The require matching id check is done at controller layer. And,
the check should be at controller layer rather than manager layer.

Change-Id: I0ee070b3640b1013982c75f62e59fac8932fe812

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-29 16:51:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Check for LUKS device via 'isLuks' subcommand

Determination of whether or not a device uses LUKS for encryption
is currently performed by parsing the output of the 'luksOpen'
command. This approach is brittle and does not handle non-English
locales.

This change replaces the existing approach with the 'isLuks' command
to determine if the device uses LUKS. In addition, test cases are
added to provide better coverage of the attach_volume operation for
encrypted volumes.

Change-Id: I99f905f8f5c7d46ecc826fa0da5d36f54f1107dc
Closes-Bug: 1372108

commit_message:
Check for LUKS device via 'isLuks' subcommand

Determination of whether or not a device uses LUKS for encryption
is currently performed by parsing the output of the 'luksOpen'
command. This approach is brittle and does not handle non-English
locales.

This change replaces the existing approach with the 'isLuks' command
to determine if the device uses LUKS. In addition, test cases are
added to provide better coverage of the attach_volume operation
for encrypted volumes.

Closes-Bug: 1372108

Change-Id: I99f905f8f5c7d46ecc826fa0da5d36f54f1107dc

commit_message:
Print expected and actual request body in fake client

Currently fake client in unit tests doesn't print anything,
if expected and actual request body is not equal and it
complicates understanding the reason of failure in unit tests.

Change-Id: I5bce747eed5615d9c67056802edf2cb1fbe87659

subject: Adds basic host kernel optimisation
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 425, 'name': 'Darren Birkett', 'email': 'darren.birkett@gmail.com', 'username': 'darren-birkett'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 9884, 'name': 'Wherenow.org CI', 'email': 'jenkins@wherenow.org', 'username': 'wherenowjenkins', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-30 09:41:02.000000000', 'files': ['rpc_deployment/roles/host_common/tasks/main.yml', 'rpc_deployment/inventory/group_vars/all.yml'], 'message': "Adds basic host kernel optimisation

This change adds three values to basic kernel optimisation which
should result in a more stable system.

Values that will be added in:
  - { key: 'vm.dirty_background_ratio', value: 5 }
  - { key: 'vm.dirty_ratio', value: 10 }
  - { key: 'vm.swappiness', value: 5 }

These values should improve general system operation and performance
when hosts have a potential for high IO. This is especially true in
a containerized environment when there are more than 20+ containers
running on a single host all potentially using LVM as the backend.

Change-Id: Ie4bf8d4d7e1b77c12bb3abec1b2d75c47ed29895
Closes-Bug: 1409755
(cherry picked from commit 98461c545eb9c3efbdb30006c057167658b2afbc)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Adds basic host kernel optimisation

This change adds three values to basic kernel optimisation which
should result in a more stable system.

Values that will be added in:
  - { key: 'vm.dirty_background_ratio', value: 5 }
  - { key: 'vm.dirty_ratio', value: 10 }
  - { key: 'vm.swappiness', value: 5 }

These values should improve general system operation and performance
when hosts have a potential for high IO. This is especially true in
a containerized environment when there are more than 20+ containers
running on a single host all potentially using LVM as the backend.

Change-Id: Ie4bf8d4d7e1b77c12bb3abec1b2d75c47ed29895
Closes-Bug: 1409755
(cherry picked from commit 98461c545eb9c3efbdb30006c057167658b2afbc)

disk: use new vfs method and option to extend

This commit renames the method is_image_partitionless
to is_image_extendable which reflect better the role of it
also uses new method and option introduced in a previous
commits to reduce the unecessary among of work done.

subject: Add scalar unit type
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6456, 'name': 'Sahdev Zala', 'email': 'spzala@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'spzala'}, {'_account_id': 7193, 'name': 'Thomas Spatzier', 'email': 'thomas.spatzier@icloud.com', 'username': 'thomasspatzier'}, {'_account_id': 9992, 'name': 'xiejunan', 'email': 'xiejunan@huawei.com', 'username': 'xiejunan'}, {'_account_id': 10818, 'name': 'Yaoguo Jiang', 'email': 'jiangyaoguo@gmail.com', 'username': 'jiangyaoguo'}, {'_account_id': 10856, 'name': 'Huruifeng', 'email': 'huruifeng@huawei.com', 'username': 'VictorHU'}, {'_account_id': 11349, 'name': 'FeihuJiang', 'email': 'jiangfeihu@huawei.com', 'username': 'Hughes'}, {'_account_id': 11602, 'name': 'Haiyang DING', 'email': 'dinghaiyang@huawei.com', 'username': 'dinghaiyang'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-27 01:39:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add scalar unit type

Implement scalar-unit.size type:

1. any number of spaces (including zero or none) is allowed between the
scalar value and the unit value.
2. support constraints like greater_or_equal and in_range. (eg:
storage_size: in_range [4 GB, 20 GB ] )
3. default unit is 'B'(byte) according to the TOSCA profile while
allowing user to set the unit of the output number as long as the input
unit is a valid one

commit_message:
Add scalar unit type

Implement scalar-unit.size type:

1. any number of spaces (including zero or none) is allowed between the
scalar value and the unit value.
2. support constraints like greater_or_equal and in_range. (eg:
storage_size: in_range [4 GB, 20 GB ] )
3. default unit is 'B'(byte) according to the TOSCA profile while
allowing user to set the unit of the output number as long as the input
unit is a valid one
4. supported scalar-unit.size (case-insensitive): B, KB, KiB, MB, MiB,
GB, GiB, TB, TiB

implement BP: add-scalar-unit-type

Change-Id: Idf3705312afd33d7aeadc3f8856cf728c41ec190

Rather than use GET and a range Jenkins uses POSTs with

commit_message:
Jenkins uses POSTs to do sequential downloads

Rather than use GET and a range Jenkins uses POSTs with
start=beginningindex to do partial downloads of the console text and
console html files. Why? Who knows. Support this ridiculousness in our
grab console log script so that we can get entire logs.

Change-Id: Ie653f3d8980dbf8e8606e6584a9c0ab40d2485ca

commit_message:
Completely refactor PKCS11 plugin

In testing Rackspace discovered a race condition with the PyKCS11
implementation that caused corrupted data to be persisted to the
database in high load conditions. After investigating, it was decided
that an appropriate solution would be to replace PyKCS11 with cffi
bindings. This has the added advantage of removing the requirement for
the forked PyKCS11.

Change-Id: Id075ecb6b1890ba78952be6aaf2b0edba4148c43

commit_message:
Updates contribution guidelines for JS object performance

In a new section, titled performance, a requirement is added
for JavaScript code to limit the re-creation of objects in
the same scope. An example with jQuery is given with explanation.

Change-Id: I2f0d8392277f65384389d8d20154d645197050af
Partial-Bug: #1412971

commit_message:
Add tracing facility to NetApp cDOT driver

It is useful for engineering to be able to see the API traffic
to and from the storage controllers, as well as to see the
progression of method calls through the driver. This work will
add a simple config option to enable various debug tracing
types to be written to the debug log at runtime.

Implements blueprint netapp-driver-tracing
Change-Id: Idf47a901abd434f256b71b2da454558878a769a2

commit_message:
Fixes SCREEN_HARDSTATUS default value

If SCREEN_HARDSTATUS is null, default it to "", not ":".

Change-Id: I52d4eb6bb494cca995e33971d5f1eec953d484fd

commit_message:
Fix FIP negative tests for nova V2.1 API

Nova V2.1 API have strong input validation.
Ia04256e0c1f9235769035cc9e7eadd864112559c adds schema for add floating ip
for strong input validation but tempest negative test fail.

In case of empty FIP, tests should expect Bad Request also in case
of V2.1.

Closes-Bug: #1414996

Change-Id: I38a2f5cb336ddd22ac920aebecf95bdcd3524a74

commit_message:
libvirt: always pass image meta when getting disk mapping

The blockinfo.get_disk_mapping method is changed to make the
image_meta parameter compulsory and the etsts updated to
ensure they always passes it

Related-bug: #1404196
Change-Id: Ifb66d6dbaf86d9404d865b456f0ecbfe2f2702fe

commit_message:
Fix centos6 image updates on hpcloud

The "yum repolist" command was failing with what I think was the
same error that the update command was designed to fix.  I am
unsure how or if that ever worked correctly, or what might have
changed to cause it to start impacting that command.

At any rate, specifying "epel*" as the repo name to disable will
cause the update command to work regardless of whether it is
installed.

Change-Id: I1d978ade76ec78e8895e00bbf64e5e40529223f8

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-11-21 20:43:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Adds keypair type database migration

Adds 'type' field to the keypair object and database tables.
Adds necessary database migration to add keypair type to the
database tables.

This commit is necessary in order to have different types
of keypairs (e.g. ssh keypair, x509 keypair)

Partially implements: blueprint keypair-x509-certificates

Change-Id: Iae18687e2ceabb22d790d5abd872d773265abcbe
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-11-24 19:24:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Adds keypair type database migration

X509 certificates are used by Windows for passwordless
authentication (WinRM) in a way which can be considered
consistent with the usage of SSH keys on Linux, as
both are based on public / private keypairs.

Adds 'type' field to the keypair object and database tables.
Adds necessary database migration to add keypair type to the
database tables.

This commit is necessary in order to have different types
of keypairs (e.g. ssh keypair, x509 keypair)

Partially implements: blueprint keypair-x509-certificates

Change-Id: Iae18687e2ceabb22d790d5abd872d773265abcbe

commit_message:
Adds keypair type database migration

X509 certificates are used by Windows for passwordless
authentication (WinRM) in a way which can be considered
consistent with the usage of SSH keys on Linux, as both
are based on public / private keypairs.

Adds 'type' field to the keypair object and database tables.
Adds necessary database migration to add keypair type to the
database tables.

This commit is necessary in order to have different types
of keypairs (e.g. ssh keypair, x509 keypair)

Partially implements: blueprint keypair-x509-certificates

Change-Id: Iae18687e2ceabb22d790d5abd872d773265abcbe

Initialize stack with ADOPT action when adopting.

Init stack with ADOPT as action so avoid returning "CREATE_IN_PROGRESS"
as state when adopting a stack.

Fact is a class used to store a single Fact.  It replaces Rule in cases where
the Fact has no negation and all the variables are bound.  The Fact uses much
less memory than a Rule for these situations since the Fact is really just a
native tuple.

FactSet is a container for Facts.  RuleSet will now use a FactSet inside to
store what we used to call literals.

The RuleSet now converts Facts to Rules before returning the rules for
get_rules(), so this change makes MaterializedView use OrderedSet directly
since MaterializedView uses DeltaRules instead of Rules.

commit_message:
Add and use Fact and FactSet

Fact is a class used to store a single Fact.  It replaces Rule in cases where
the Fact has no negation and all the variables are bound.  The Fact uses much
less memory than a Rule for these situations since the Fact is really just a
native tuple.

FactSet is a container for Facts.  RuleSet will now use a FactSet inside to
store what we used to call literals.

The RuleSet now converts Facts to Rules before returning the rules for
get_rules(), so this change makes MaterializedView use OrderedSet directly
since MaterializedView uses DeltaRules instead of Rules.

Implements blueprint: fact-datastructure
Change-Id: I5ac47075288f50fe027b94abc76724cb18370f3c

Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 1849, 'name': 'Joe Gordon', 'email': 'joe.gordon0@gmail.com', 'username': 'jogo'}, {'_account_id': 10068, 'name': 'Welcome, new contributor!', 'username': 'welcome-message'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-30 05:49:02.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/v1_1/volumes.py'], 'message': 'Update volumes.get() docstring to correctly reflect functionality

The get() command gets a volume based on an id. It does not have
anything to do with deleting a volume, and thus should not be documented
as such.

Change-Id: Id62fb07ddd9024ee02090201ce1b679d4968b168

commit_message:
Update volumes.get() docstring to correctly reflect functionality

The get() command gets a volume based on an id. It does not have
anything to do with deleting a volume, and thus should not be documented
as such.

Change-Id: Id62fb07ddd9024ee02090201ce1b679d4968b168

commit_message:
Several small fixes

1) Checking whether docker is accessible on the build host
does not see to work without using sudo. So fixed that.
2) Made checking of glance accessibility dependent on the
image_storage used
3) Using docker_registry_endpoint which contains IP:port
4) Parsing of heat stack output from the right location

Change-Id: I01c05a8f9f26dcf60887ff7d9093eb8dfdcac367

commit_message:
Reply with a meaningful exception when ports are over the quota limit

Currently, neutron client api returns a negative number
for max_net_count, when the number of port is over the quota limit,
instead of raising a meaningful exception.
Raising an PortLimitExceeded exception, when the above issue occur.

Closes-Bug: #1401171
Change-Id: I5c9c7276f1d90e856ecc6b8c40e7efab4a625796

commit_message:
Remove rhel6 and py26 support

el6 is shipped with Python 2.6.x which is not expected
to be supported with the openstack kilo release.

For el6 support we need to do lot of thing differently,
which makes the code more complicated.

This change removes el6 and py26 support from devstack.

This change also removed a discontinued (1 year ago)
openSUSE 12.2 code path, which used a similar codepath as el6.

Several comment related to el6 also removed or modified.

Change-Id: Iea0b0c98a5e11fd85bb5e93c099f740fe05d2f3a

commit_message:
Changed it so you have to explicitly choose the detailed process metrics.

Fixed process setup for kafka and zookeeper.
Also fixed dimensions for the pid_count and made it so pid_count can go
higher than 1 for non-exact matches.

Change-Id: Ia8f44ddf668b976480afcf203eb11fa696f71b5e

subject: Fix H238 to allow parent classes to be returned by a function
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1669, 'name': 'Julien Danjou', 'display_name': 'jd', 'email': 'julien@danjou.info', 'username': 'jdanjou'}, {'_account_id': 1849, 'name': 'Joe Gordon', 'email': 'joe.gordon0@gmail.com', 'username': 'jogo'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 12000, 'name': 'Ian Cordasco', 'email': 'sigmavirus24@gmail.com', 'username': 'sigmavirus24'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-20 13:47:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'E238: allow to use a function in parent class

Change-Id: Ie7cea4156f0da5bf72d16e5eb5f4e13b7c095d3f
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-01-21 08:52:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix H238 to allow parent classes to be returned by a function

There was a corner case that wasn't caught before where
you would want to declare a class like this:

    class Foo(somefunc()):

but this falsely triggered H238. This allows for that and
adds one more docstring update for a failure case.

Change-Id: Ie7cea4156f0da5bf72d16e5eb5f4e13b7c095d3f
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-01-21 15:31:33.000000000', 'files': ['hacking/checks/python23.py'], 'message': "Fix H238 to allow parent classes to be returned by a function

There was a corner case that wasn't caught before where
you would want to declare a class like this:

    class Foo(six.with_metaclass(abc.ABCMeta, object)):

but this falsely triggered H238. This allows for that and
adds one more docstring update for a failure case.

Change-Id: Ie7cea4156f0da5bf72d16e5eb5f4e13b7c095d3f
", 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Fix H238 to allow parent classes to be returned by a function

There was a corner case that wasn't caught before where
you would want to declare a class like this:

    class Foo(six.with_metaclass(abc.ABCMeta, object)):

but this falsely triggered H238. This allows for that and
adds one more docstring update for a failure case.

Change-Id: Ie7cea4156f0da5bf72d16e5eb5f4e13b7c095d3f

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-25 17:01:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Split up assignments and make the assignments piece pluggable

This is an early WIP for the first phase of the (as yet unapproved)
bp to split up the current assignment components in the base
entities plus the actual assignmnet piece.  It is provided just
to give a flavour of what would be invloved - and is not ready
for merging (nor will it even pass jenkins).

This first version of the patch only splits up the manager and driver
portions.  Subsequent patches would:

- split the controllers
- split the unit tests

One of the side effect benefits listed in the bp is that we should
be able to rationalize the true assignments code. The need for this
is made evident with this patch - we have far too many duplicate
ways of extracting the assignments for particular entities. The act
of creating this WIP enabled me to find three separate bugs in our
existing code - which have come about due to the complexity of the
current code.

Partially implements: bp pluggable-assignments

Change-Id: I503fbcfa9fb141a3769aa831b8c6a429ba37c498
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-10-25 17:13:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Split up assignments and make the assignments piece pluggable

existing code - which have come about due to the complexity of the
current code. With other changes in-flight with regard to the
general list_role_assignments() method, we should consider radically
radionallizing the multiple versions of similar assignment driver
methods.

Partially implements: bp pluggable-assignments

Change-Id: I503fbcfa9fb141a3769aa831b8c6a429ba37c498
', 'number': 6}, {'created': '2014-10-28 17:10:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Split up assignments and make the assignments piece pluggable

This is a WIP for the first phase of the (as yet unapproved)
bp to split up the current assignment components in the base
entities plus the actual assignmnet piece. It is provided just
to give a flavor of what would be invloved - and is not yet ready
for merging.

This first patch only splits up the manager and driver portions.
Subsequent patches would:

- split the controllers
- split the unit tests

One of the key side effect benefits listed in the bp is that we should
be able to rationalize the true assignments code. The need for this
is made evident with this patch - we have far too many duplicate
ways of extracting the assignments for particular entities. The act
of creating this WIP enabled me to find four separate bugs in our
existing code - which have come about due to the complexity of the
current code. With other changes in-flight with regard to the
general list_role_assignments() method, we should consider radically
radionallizing the multiple versions of similar assignment driver
methods.

Partially implements: bp pluggable-assignments

', 'number': 37}, {'created': '2015-01-06 05:29:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Make unit tests call the new reource manager.

This is the part of the more comprehensive split of
assignments, which rationalizes both the backend and controllers.
In order to make this change easier for reviewers, it is divided
into a number of smaller patches.

Previous patches have:

- Moved role management into its own manager and drivers
- Fixed incorrect doc strings for grant driver methods
- Updated controllers to call the new role manager
- Updated unit tests to call the new role manager
- Refactored the assignment manager and drivers enabling
  projects/domains to be split out
- Fixed incorrect comment about circular dependency between
  assignment and identity
- Moved the logically separated project and domain
  functionality into their own manager/backend (called resource).
- Removes unused pointer to assignment from identity driver
- Uddated controllers and managers to call the new resource
  manager

This patch updates all the unit tests to call the new resource
manager to access projects and domains.

Future patches will:
- Split the assignment controller, giving projects/domains
  their own controller

Partially implements: bp pluggable-assignments
Change-Id: I503fbcfa9fb141a3769aa831b8c6a429ba37c498

commit_message:
Make unit tests call the new resource manager

This is the part of the more comprehensive split of
assignments, which rationalizes both the backend and controllers.
In order to make this change easier for reviewers, it is divided
into a number of smaller patches.

Previous patches have:

- Moved role management into its own manager and drivers
- Fixed incorrect doc strings for grant driver methods
- Updated controllers to call the new role manager
- Updated unit tests to call the new role manager
- Refactored the assignment manager and drivers enabling
  projects/domains to be split out
- Fixed incorrect comment about circular dependency between
  assignment and identity
- Moved the logically separated project and domain
  functionality into their own manager/backend (called resource).
- Removes unused pointer to assignment from identity driver
- Uddated controllers and managers to call the new resource
  manager

This patch updates all the unit tests to call the new resource
manager to access projects and domains.

Future patches will:
- Split the assignment controller, giving projects/domains
  their own controller

Partially implements: bp pluggable-assignments
Change-Id: I503fbcfa9fb141a3769aa831b8c6a429ba37c498

subject: Make controllers and managers reference new resource manager

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-11-10 17:05:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Ensure controllers and managers reference new resource manager.

As part of the blueprint for splitting up the assignments component
the crud operations for domain, project and role are now in the new
resource manager/driver. Although the assignment manager has
temporary scaffolding to redirect any appropriate calls to the
resource manager, it is better if we make the call to the right
place initially.

The tests will be updated to call the correct manager in a futher
patch.

Partially implements: bp pluggable-assignment

commit_message:
Make controllers and managers reference new resource manager

This is the part of the more comprehensive split of
assignments, which rationalizes both the backend and controllers.
In order to make this change easier for reviewers, it is divided
into a number of smaller patches.

Previous patches have:

- Moved role management into its own manager and drivers
- Fixed incorrect doc strings for grant driver methods
- Updated controllers to call the new role manager
- Updated unit tests to call the new role manager
- Refactored the assignment manager and drivers enabling
  projects/domains to be split out
- Fixed incorrect comment about circular dependency between
  assignment and identity
- Moved the logically separated project and domain
  functionality into their own manager/backend (called resource).
- Removes unused pointer to assignment from identity driver

This patch updates all the controllers and managers to call the
new resource manager to access projects and domains.

Future patches will:

- Update the tests to call the new resource manager
- Split the assignment controller, giving projects/domains
  their own controller

Partially implements: bp pluggable-assignments
Change-Id: I7180c5a324c44a22e40a367797d9bcd1d2ae79f2

commit_message:
Remove unused pointer to assignment in identity driver

The code in identity core that configures the driver stores a
reference to the assignment_api in it. This is never used, so
should be removed.

Closes-bug: 1407540

Change-Id: I4d677c74461eb319ba49d5c41d0ff86fc973a849

This is the part of the more comprehensive split of
assignments, which rationalizes both the backend and controllers.
In order to make this change easier for reviewers, it is divided
into a number of smaller patches.

Previous patches have:

- Moved role management into its own manager and drivers

- Updated controllers to call the new role manager

- Update the tests to call the new manager
- Split the assignment controller, giving projects/domains
  their own controller

commit_message:
Move projects and domains to their own backend

This is the part of the more comprehensive split of
assignments, which rationalizes both the backend and controllers.
In order to make this change easier for reviewers, it is divided
into a number of smaller patches.

Previous patches:

- Move role management into its own manager and drivers
  (see: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/144239/)
- Fix incorrect doc strings for grant driver methods
  (see: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/144403/)
- Make controllers call the new, split out, role manager
  (see: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/144494/)
- Make unit tests call the new, split out, role manager
  (see: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/144548/)
- Refactor the assignment manager and drivers, enabling
  projects/domains to be split out
  (see: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/144650/)
- Fix incorrect comment about circular dependency between
  assignment and identity
  (see: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/144850/)

This patch moves the now logically separated project and domain
functionality into their own manager/backend (called resource).

Future patches will:

- Remove unused pointer to assignment in identity driver
- Update the controllers to call the new resource manager
- Update the tests to call the new resource manager
- Split the assignment controller, giving projects/domains
  their own controller

Partially implements: bp pluggable-assignments

Change-Id: I0ff1c2fa30237734d0a25d03dad5be03eb166367

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-12-11 20:04:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Do not pass PXE net config from bootloader to ramdisk

All PXE templates currently pass network configuration from the
bootloader to the ramdisk via a kernel parameter,
ip=$ip:$tftp-server:$gateway:$netmask. The current deploy-ironic
ramdisks built by DIB uses this to bring up networking manually,
but this behavior exists there for non-PXE deployments. We ideally
want ramdisks use DHCP to allow configuring more than just ip/gw/nm.
This updates PXE templates to not pass net config, since DHCP is
assumed to be functioning for all PXE env.

Closes-bug: 1401298

Change-Id: Icc04de7b8b7324ce685f930d2e8074b0c764fc0c
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-12-13 00:10:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Do not pass PXE net config from bootloader to ramdisk

All PXE templates currently pass network configuration from the
bootloader to the ramdisk via a kernel parameter,
ip=$ip:$tftp-server:$gateway:$netmask. The current deploy-ironic
ramdisks built by DIB uses this to bring up networking manually,
but this behavior exists there for non-PXE deployments where DHCP
is unavailable.  We ideally want ramdisks to use DHCP to allow pushing
more than just ip/gw/nm. This updates PXE templates to not pass net config,
since DHCP is assumed to be functioning for all PXE env.  Without the
ip= parameter, the ramdisk has no easy way to resolve the boot server's
address.  To signal where to callback to, a boot_server parameter has
been added that points back to the TFTP server address.

Closes-bug: 1401298

Change-Id: Icc04de7b8b7324ce685f930d2e8074b0c764fc0c

commit_message:
Do not pass PXE net config from bootloader to ramdisk

All PXE templates currently pass network configuration from the
bootloader to the ramdisk via a kernel parameter,
ip=$ip:$tftp-server:$gateway:$netmask. The current deploy-ironic
ramdisks built by DIB uses this to bring up networking manually,
but this behavior exists there for non-PXE deployments where DHCP
is unavailable.  We ideally want ramdisks to use DHCP to allow pushing
more than just ip/gw/nm. This updates PXE templates to not pass net config,
since DHCP is assumed to be functioning for all PXE env.  Without the
ip= parameter, the ramdisk has no easy way to resolve the boot server's
address.  To signal where to callback to, a boot_server parameter has
been added that points back to the TFTP server address.

Closes-bug: 1401298

commit_message:
Changed hardcoded Mongodb username to variable

The operating system user used by MongoDB for its files
and processes was hardcoded to "mongodb" for Debian. Other
linux variants use different users. This adds a variable,
MONGO_USER which is set depending on the guest O/S.

Change-Id: I5b47243ff13607766adfc3337d4e31d4c0598c2a
Closes-bug: 1416155

commit_message:
Fix bug wth missing username on database_user resource

I missed a commit with last change to this part.  The
change was to make the resource unique, but the username attribute
was not added to the resource so it will fail.

Change-Id: I78e84078ab1f1e2919131a6a443a14d8815c02a6
Related-Bug: #1409921

commit_message:
Add LBaaS in the lab scripts

This patch adds support to enable neutron LBaaS support in the
training guide's OpenStack installation.

Changes made are as follows

* Pre-download neutron-lbaas-agent to base disk
* Enable LBaaS support on horizon on controller node
* Configure neutron server to support LBaaS with haproxy as provider
  on controller node
* Enable and configure LBaaS agent on network node

Change-Id: I35f8c19ebceb7420f735354337bf71b4d92edf93
Closes-Bug: 1414767

commit_message:
Suspend Py3K jobs for oslo.messaging oslo.rootwrap

Temporarily remove the python3-jobs template from oslo.messaging and
oslo.rootwrap, to be reinstated once the Python 3.4 on Ubuntu Trusty
is fixed to permit running these tests there or once we have another
suitable platform available for them.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-January/055270.html

Change-Id: I434cd5115b74c296d184ac716be55496c5c7307a
Related-Bug: #1348954
Related-Bug: #1367907
Related-Bug: #1382607

commit_message:
Add "Back To Previous Page" link from all Detail pages

While looking at the Instance Details (or any details pages), it
is great to have a quick link to get back to the previous page.
This will give users a quick step back to the full Instances table
view without having to rely on the browser back button.

Change-Id: Id361e7e0470bea70c8805ff5d7b2bb011f3d8984
Co-Authored-By: Swati Shukla <swati.shukla1@tcs.com>
Closes-Bug: #1100318

commit_message:
Expose fixtures through oslo_log.fixture

Expose the fixtures through the package import instead of requiring the
user to import each module.

Add documentation for the fixtures.

Change-Id: Ic96a030c45853406c2b77740b26d168cb8882f5c

commit_message:
Add missing indexes in SQLite and PostgreSQL

Some indexes have been created on MySQL databases in past database
migrations but not SQLite or PostgreSQL databases. Complicating the
matter is the fact that MySQL is more lenient with index namespacing
than other databases.

Change-Id: If24b45b722d03168463dfd67d67a39d4fb45f77d
Partially-implements: blueprint validate-migrations-and-model

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-30 16:38:56.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_log/fixture/setlevel.py', 'oslo_log/tests/unit/fixture/test_setlevel.py'], 'message': 'Add fixture to let tests change log levels

Some tests need to alter the log levels for modules dynamically. This
fixture lets them control the level without worrying about resetting the

Change-Id: I6ce509725ae23a33704d1f5b5b9af189470f03fc
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add fixture to let tests change log levels

Some tests need to alter the log levels for modules dynamically. This
fixture lets them control the level without worrying about resetting the
value or messing around with underlying implementation.

Change-Id: I6ce509725ae23a33704d1f5b5b9af189470f03fc

subject: Rename logging fixture module
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-30 16:38:56.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_log/tests/unit/fixture/test_logging_error.py', 'oslo_log/fixture/logging_error.py'], 'message': 'Rename logging fixture module

Using the name "logging" conflicts with the Python standard library
module of the same name, which causes issues when we try to add another
module in this directory which imports logging. Rename the logging
module to a more descriptive and unique name.

Change-Id: If4017edbc0f8dedba07aa6bdeedc80e0aea3f7c6
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Rename logging fixture module

Using the name "logging" conflicts with the Python standard library
module of the same name, which causes issues when we try to add another
module in this directory which imports logging. Rename the logging
module to a more descriptive and unique name.

Change-Id: If4017edbc0f8dedba07aa6bdeedc80e0aea3f7c6

commit_message:
Execute unit tests and build DU

- Start from the languagepack provided in the planfile
- Inject user code
- Execute the unit test commands provided in the planfile
- Create a deployment unit with the users code based on the
  languagepack selected by the user.

Change-Id: Ic49521d04b92f660a6b4b8251e0caec405ff7f3a

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-20 21:31:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Introduce run_cmd in the planfile

I'm adding a run commnad to the planfile. This is the application
entry point and should be provided by the application developer.

I've also refactored the way test and run commands are passed to
the unit_test and build scripts. It was getting messy as we add
new variables.

This patch takes the run command from the plan file and passes it
to the build-app script. The command is not being used to start the
application code yet. That will be submitted in a different patch.

Change-Id: I9ef36b8f25a3b4c17fcd9fdec3d0e9e2423bf86f

commit_message:
Introduce run_cmd in the planfile

I'm adding a run commnad to the planfile. This is the application
entry point and should be provided by the application developer.

I've also refactored the way test and run commands are passed to
the unit_test and build scripts. It was getting messy as we add
new variables.

This patch takes the run command from the plan file and passes it
to the build-app script. The command is not being used to start the
application code yet. That will be submitted in a different patch.

Change-Id: I9ef36b8f25a3b4c17fcd9fdec3d0e9e2423bf86f

commit_message:
Make image storage configurable.

- Changed name of image storage config flag from du_storage to image_storage
- Added support for storing languagepack and DU images in
  docker_registry, glance and swift.

Change-Id: Ic0e4ca584fb81341021e6db4b304d742d612d838

commit_message:
Remove H238 comment from tox.ini

Commit a8a87900cf99e8759849a274d5ac19baa2e7f0f7 removed
H238 from the flake8 ignore list but missed removing the
comment about why we were ignoring it in the first place.

Change-Id: I1fd89aafeea50bead18c8bf4ffdc7577ded2bde3

commit_message:
Improve testing of the Node's REST API

Clean up the unit tests which exercise the REST API for Node provision
state.

This patch does not change any of the asserted status or error codes.

Change-Id: I83dc32a90457848741224f7c6e6d6caff7cba60e
Implements: blueprint new-ironic-state-machine

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2889, 'name': 'Aeva Black', 'email': 'aeva.online@gmail.com', 'username': 'tenbrae'}, {'_account_id': 5805, 'name': 'Chris Krelle', 'email': 'nobodycam@gmail.com', 'username': 'nobodycam'}, {'_account_id': 6618, 'name': 'Ruby Loo', 'email': 'opensrloo@gmail.com', 'username': 'rloo'}, {'_account_id': 6773, 'name': 'Lucas Alvares Gomes', 'email': 'lucasagomes@gmail.com', 'username': 'lucasagomes'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 10342, 'name': 'Jay Faulkner', 'display_name': 'JayF', 'email': 'jay@jvf.cc', 'username': 'JayF'}, {'_account_id': 10343, 'name': 'Jim Rollenhagen', 'email': 'jim@jimrollenhagen.com', 'username': 'jimrollenhagen'}, {'_account_id': 12081, 'name': 'IBM xCAT CI', 'email': 'xcat@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibm-xcat-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-23 20:59:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Rename NOSTATE to AVAILABLE

This patch adds the new provisioning state AVAILABLE.

A database migration is added which updates all DB records'
provision_state from NOSTATE to AVAILABLE.

Since database migrations and code changes may be rolled out at
different times, the conductor can deploy to a node in either
NOSTATE or AVAILABLE states.

OperatorImpact:
    this change should be rolled out to production services, and the
    conductor service should be restarted, *before* the database
    migration is applied.

DocImpact:
    this change updates the Node provision_state value which represents
    a node that is "available" for provisioning. It is changed from
    NOSTATE to AVAILABLE

Implements: bp/new-ironic-state-machine

Change-Id: I5e6f6ee5877d475136ce2ebad4a9333b424dc96b

', 'number': 3}, {'created': '2015-01-24 18:40:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Rename NOSTATE to AVAILABLE

This patch adds the new provisioning state AVAILABLE.

A database migration is added which updates all DB records'
provision_state from NOSTATE to AVAILABLE.

Since database migrations and code changes may be rolled out at
different times, the conductor can deploy to a node in either
NOSTATE or AVAILABLE states.

*** NOTE ***
Nova interprets the provision_state of Nodes to determine which should
be exposed to the scheduler and counted as available resources. Up to
the Juno release, Nova looked for the "NOSTATE" state to indicate this.
Therefor, Nova *must* include commit Idbd36b230cf997bed7a86c3f56cf9c70995028b2
prior to applying this change to Ironic.

OperatorImpact:
    This change should be rolled out to production services, and the
    conductor service should be restarted, *before* the database
    migration is applied.

DocImpact:
    This change updates the Node provision_state value which represents
    a node that is "available" for provisioning. It is changed from
    NOSTATE to AVAILABLE

Implements: blueprint new-ironic-state-machine

Change-Id: I5e6f6ee5877d475136ce2ebad4a9333b424dc96b
', 'number': 4}, {'created': '2015-01-25 23:49:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Rename NOSTATE to AVAILABLE

This patch adds the new provisioning state AVAILABLE.

A database migration is added which updates all DB records'
provision_state from NOSTATE to AVAILABLE.

Since database migrations and code changes may be rolled out at
different times, the conductor can deploy to a node in either
NOSTATE or AVAILABLE states.

*** NOTE ***
Nova interprets the provision_state of Nodes to determine which should
be exposed to the scheduler and counted as available resources. Up to
the Juno release, Nova looked for the "NOSTATE" state to indicate this.
Therefor, Nova *must* include commit Idbd36b230cf997bed7a86c3f56cf9c70995028b2
prior to applying this change to Ironic.

OperatorImpact:
    This change should be rolled out to production services, and the
    conductor service should be restarted, *before* the database
    migration is applied. Ironic will then begin "translating" existing
    node states to the new AVAILABLE state automatically when it touches
    them. If the DB migration is run much later, it may not actually
    update any records (and that is OK).

DocImpact:
    This change updates the Node provision_state value which represents
    a node that is "available" for provisioning. It is changed from
    NOSTATE to AVAILABLE

Implements: blueprint new-ironic-state-machine

This patch adds the new provisioning state AVAILABLE, and bumps the API

provision_state="None" to provision_state="available" for nodes which
are available for use.

A database migration is added which updates all DB records'
provision_state from NOSTATE to AVAILABLE.

Since database migrations and code changes may be rolled out at
different times, the conductor can deploy to a node in either
NOSTATE or AVAILABLE states.

OperatorImpact:
    This change should be rolled out to production services, and the
    conductor service should be restarted, *before* the database
    migration is applied. Ironic will then begin "translating" existing
    node states to the new AVAILABLE state automatically when it touches
    them. If the DB migration is run much later, it may not actually
    update any records (and that is OK).

DocImpact:
    This change updates the Node provision_state value which represents
    a node that is available for provisioning. It is changed from
    "None" to "available", but this change is only realized when the
    X-OpenStack-Ironic-API-Version header is >= 1.1

*** NOTE ***
Nova interprets the provision_state of Nodes to determine which should
be exposed to the scheduler and counted as available resources. Up to
the Juno release, Nova looked for the "NOSTATE" state to indicate this,
represented as provision_state=None.
After commit Idbd36b230cf997bed7a86c3f56cf9c70995028b2 landed in Nova,
both the old "None" and new "available" states are interpreted in this
way. As such, Nova may continue to use Juno Ironic, which did not
support microversions, or may begin using the 1.1 version.

Implements: blueprint new-ironic-state-machine

Change-Id: I5e6f6ee5877d475136ce2ebad4a9333b424dc96b
